result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

Defendant Laron J Smith in court. Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Defendant Laron J Smith. State moves to find counts 1 and 2 transactionally related. DE states no objection. Court finds counts 1 and 2 transactionally related. Witness Detective C. J. duly sworn and testified. State with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Fredrickson with cross. States moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, gives argument. Court finds PC for bindover.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:54 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
